metadata.name: Potential Base64 Decoded From Images
metadata.comment: Detects the use of tail to extract bytes at an offset from an image and then decode the base64 value to create a new file with the decoded content. The detected execution is a bash one-liner.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/bash')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tail')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-c')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('base64')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-d')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('>')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.avif')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.gif')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.jfif')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.jpeg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.jpg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.pjp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.pjpeg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.png')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.svg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.webp'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of tail to extract bytes at an offset from an image and then decode the base64 value to create a new file with the decoded content. The detected execution is a bash one-liner.
